page.title: 10Fordham Abbey, Fordham.
page.content: The present Fordham Abbey was built in 1790. Only the Dove Cote remains of the original site where the Gilberteen Monks used to live. There are 60 acres of grass-land and 200 acres of arable land and the live-stock includes a herd of cattle. The present owners and their children have lived in the house for 25 years. Recently they have built modern offices and out-buildings as the farm has grown.The owners employ 8 staff comprising 4 farm workers and 4 domestic staff. Through their land flows the River Snail which is now polluted because of the nearby sewage works. Their land contains a chalk pit, a wood with a water-tower, and below this a natural spring from which their Hereford/Fresian cattle drink.
